sen.j: 北村美術館（きたむらびじゅつかん）は、京都市上京区にある、古美術・茶道具を中心とした私立美術館である。
sen.e: Kitamura Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to antiquities and tea utensils, located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kitamura Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to antiquities and tea utensils, located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kitamura Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to antiquities and tea utensils, located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 実業家で茶人でもあった北村謹次郎（1904－1991）の収集品を保存するために昭和50年(1975)に財団法人北村文華財団が設立され、美術館は昭和52年(1977)開館した。
sen.e: In 1975, Kitamura Bunka Foundation was established to store collections of Kitamura Kinjiro (1904-1991), a businessman and tea ceremony lover, and Kitamura Museum was opened in 1977.
sen.cmt: 財団法人北村文華財団→[定訳不明]Kitamura Bunka Foundation（財団法人北村文華財団）
sen.e: In 1975, Kitamura Culture Foundation was established to store the collections of Kitamura Kinjiro (1904-1991), a businessman and tea ceremony lover, and Kitamura Museum was opened in 1977.
In 1975, Kitamura Culture Foundation was established to store the collections of Kitamura Kinjiro (1904-1991), a businessman and tea ceremony lover, and Kitamura Museum was opened in 1977.

sen.j: 所蔵品には国の重要文化財14件を含む。
sen.e: Its collections include National Important Cultural Properties.
Its collections include National Important Cultural Properties.
Its collections include 14 National Important Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 北村家は、奈良県吉野地方で代々林業を営む旧家である。
sen.e: The Kitamuras is an old family who have been engaged in forest industry over generations in Yoshino Area, Nara Prefecture.
The Kitamuras are an old family who have been engaged in forestry over many generations in Yoshino, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「is」→「are」, 「forest industry」→「forestry」, 「many」挿入, 「Area」削除 - the word 'area' is vague, and not usually part of a place name.
sen.e: The Kitamuras are an old family who have been engaged in forestry over many generations in Yoshino, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 北村は、家業の林業を営むかたわら、夫婦で茶道と美術品収集に励んだ。
sen.e: Kinjiro KITAMURA and his wife were enthusiastic about tea ceremony and collection of art works, while doing their family business of forestry.
Besides their family business of forestry, Kinjiro KITAMURA and his wife were enthusiastic about the tea ceremony and collecting works of art.
Besides their family business of forestry, Kinjiro KITAMURA and his wife were enthusiastic about the tea ceremony and collecting works of art.

sen.j: 茶人のコレクションという性格から、茶碗をはじめとする茶器の名品が多い。
sen.e: Their collection includes many famed tea utensils, such as tea bowls, because they loved tea ceremony.
Their collection includes many fine tea utensils, such as tea bowls, because they loved the tools of the tea ceremony.
sen.cmt: 「famed」→「fine」- I think the intended meaning is that they are well made rather than famous. 「the tools of the」挿入 - without this, this part of the sentence is repetitive.
sen.e: Their collection includes many fine tea utensils, such as tea bowls, because they loved the tools of the tea ceremony.

sen.j: また、傑出した茶人であった北村の眼で選ばれた絵画、古筆などにも名品が揃っている。
sen.e: The collection also includes many famous paintings and calligraphies selected by Kinjiro KITAMURA himself who was an outstanding master of tea ceremony.
The collection also includes many famous paintings and pieces of calligraphy selected by Kinjiro KITAMURA, himself an outstanding master of the tea ceremony.
sen.cmt: Calligraphy is uncountable. 「himself who was」→「, himself」, 「the」挿入
sen.e: The collection also includes many famous paintings and pieces of calligraphy selected by Kinjiro KITAMURA, himself an outstanding master of the tea ceremony.

sen.j: これら掛軸類も茶席の床（とこ）に掛けることを意識して選ばれた、広い意味の「茶道具」の範疇に入るものであろう。
sen.e: Hanging scrolls are among them, because they were probably considered tea utensils in a broad sense to be hung on the alcove during a tea ceremony.
Hanging scrolls form part of the collection, because they were probably considered tea utensils in a broad sense, to be hung in the alcove during a ceremony.
sen.cmt: 「are among them」→「form part of the collection」, 「,」挿入, 「tea」削除 - clear from the context, 「on」→「in」
sen.e: Hanging scrolls form part of the collection, because they were probably considered tea utensils in a broad sense, to be hung in the alcove during a ceremony.

sen.j: 隣接する北村邸の庭園は東山の緑を借景にしたもので、庭内には国の重要文化財指定の石灯篭2点、石塔1点がある。
sen.e: His garden next to his house has the view of the woods of Higashiyama area on its back, and it has two stone lanterns and a stone pagoda, which are designated National Important Cultural Properties.

The garden next to his house has a view of the woods of the Higashiyama area as its background, and it has two stone lanterns and a stone pagoda, which are designated National Important Cultural Properties.

The garden next to his house has a view of the woods of the Higashiyama area as its background, and it has two stone lanterns and a stone pagoda, which are designated National Important Cultural Properties.

tit.cmt: The following list contains some singular items, so 'collections' is not appropriate I think.

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Properties:
Important Cultural Properties:
Important Cultural Properties:

sen.j: 紙本著色藤原仲文像（佐竹本三十六歌仙）
sen.e: Shihon Choshoku Fujiwara no Nakafumi zo: one of Satakebon Sanjurokkasen (Satake version Thirty-six Great Poets)
Shihon Choshoku Fujiwara no Nakafumi zo: one of Satakebon Sanjurokkasen (Satake version Thirty-six Great Poets)
Figure of FUJIWARA no Nakafumi, Color Painting on Paper : one of Satake version Thirty-six Great Poets, which used be stored by Satake family in Akita
sen.cmt: 「紙本著色」がわかるように訳し直しました。

sen.j: 紙本墨画淡彩鳶鴉図（とびからすず）2幅 与謝蕪村筆
sen.e: Shihon Bokuga Tansai Tobikarasuzu, Futano (double width) by Yosa BUSON
Shihon Bokuga Tansai Tobikarasuzu, Futano (double width) by Yosa BUSON
A Black Kite (a bird) and a Crow, Monochrome Light Ink Painting on Paper (a pair of scrolls) by Yosa BUSON
sen.cmt: 。「紙本墨画淡彩鳶鴉図」がわかるように訳し直しました。

sen.j: 夕顔蒔絵硯箱
sen.e: Yugao Makie Suzuribako
Yugao Makie Suzuribako
Writing Box with Yugao (morning glory family), Makie-lacquerware
sen.cmt: 夕顔と蒔絵を結びつけた英語サイトは見つかりませんでした。[定訳不明，参考URL(http://www.tnm.jp/en/servlet/Con?pageId=B01&processId=01&event_id=6377)

sen.j: 牡丹唐草文螺鈿経箱 - 高麗時代
sen.e: Botan Karakusamon Radenkyobako (Goryeo Period in Korea)
Botan Karakusamon Radenkyobako (Goryeo Period in Korea)
Sutra Box with Peony Arabesques, Raden-lacquerware (Goryeo Period in Korea)
sen.cmt: 以下の二つのサイトを参考に訳し直しました。[定訳不明(http://www.emuseum.jp/cgi/pkihon.cgi?SyoID=7&ID=w007&SubID=s000)(http://www.emuseum.jp/cgi/pkihon.cgi?SyoID=7&ID=w074&SubID=s000)]

sen.j: 金銅金錍（こんどうこんぺい） - 金錍は仏具の一種
sen.e: Kondo Konpei (Konpei is one of Buddhist altar articles)
Kondo Konpei (Konpei is one of the articles used in a Buddhist altar)
sen.cmt: 「Buddhist altar articles」→「the articles used in a Buddhist altar」
sen.e: Gilt Bronze Konpei (Konpei is one of the articles used in a Buddhist altar)
sen.cmt: 翻訳者の方：Kondo に英語の説明つけました。

sen.j: 織部松皮菱形手鉢 - 益田孝（鈍翁）旧蔵
sen.e: Oribe Shouhi Hishigata Tebach - formerly stored by Takashi MASUDA (Donnou)
sen.cmt: 織部松皮菱形手鉢→Oribe Shouhi Hishigata Tebachi[定訳不明」
sen.e: Oribe Shouhi Hishigata Tebachi - formerly stored by Takashi MASUDA (Donnou)
Oribe Ceramic Basket with Pine Bark Diamond: formerly stored by Takashi MASUDA (also known by the pseudonym Donnou)
sen.cmt: 以下のサイトでphotoと表現を組み合わせて訳し直しました。[定訳不明，参考 PHOTO (http://www.sengoku-expo.net/tea/J/26-755.html)参考 URL (http://www.worthpoint.com/worthopedia/great-oribe-ceramic-basket-w-geometrical-décor)参考 URL 松皮菱 = pine bark diamond については:(http://www.hms.org.il/Museum/Templates/showpage.asp?DBID=1&LNGID=1&TMID=84&FID=1372&PID=3042)]

sen.j: 色絵鱗波文茶碗 野々村仁清

sen.j: 藤原範宗筆懐紙
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Norimune Japanese tissue
FUJIWARA no Norimune Japanese tissue

sen.j: 後深草天皇宸翰消息（十月五日）
sen.e: Gofukakusa Tenno Shinkan Shosoku (Emperor Gofukakusa's Letter, on 5th of the tenth month)
sen.cmt: 旧暦では，１０月が太陽暦のOctoberと一致するとは限りませんので，the tenth month を使用しました．
sen.e: Gofukakusa Tenno Shinkan Shosoku (Emperor Gofukakusa's Letter, of the 5th of the tenth month)
sen.cmt: 「on」→「of the」. Is there a particular reason not to use October?
sen.e: Gofukakusa Tenno Shinkan Shosoku (Emperor Gofukakusa's Letter, of the 5th of the tenth month)

sen.j: 丹波国牒（承平二年九月廿二日）
sen.e: Tanba no Kuni Chou (Tanba Administrative Document) (9th of the ninth month, second year of Shohei)
Tanba no Kuni Chou (Tanba Administrative Document) (9th of the ninth month, second year of Shohei)
Tanba no Kuni Cho (Tanba Administrative Document) (9th of the ninth month, second year of Shohei)

sen.j: 和漢朗詠集 巻上断簡（鹿）（大字朗詠）

Wakanroeishu Wakanroeishu (Fragment of the Naiji Edition of the Anthology of Japanese and Chinese Verses for Recitation, Volume 1, Deer) out of Daijiroei
Fragment of the Anthology of Japanese and Chinese Verses for Recitation, Volume 1, Deer (the Daiji Wakan Roei Shu Poetry Anthology, attributed to FUJIWARA no Kozei, a master of calligrapher)
sen.cmt: Daijiroei に英語の説明つけました。Wakanroeishu 繰り返し削除

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道 出町柳駅 徒歩10分
sen.e: From Demachiyanagi Station of Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., ten minutes on foot.
Ten minutes on foot from Demachiyanagi Station on the Keihan Electric Railway.
